name.namePart: United States District Court Northern District of Ohio

titleInfo.title: Shepherd v. DePuy Orthopaedics, Inc.
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER: This case is REFERRED to the Magistrate Judge for customized case management in accordance with Local Rule 16.01. Discovery is not stayedabsent order of the District Judge. This case shall be set for trial upon completion of the initial case management conference by order of the District Judge in accordance with the procedures of Local Rule 16.01(d)(5). Signed by Chief Judge Todd J. Campbell on 12/20/10. (dt) [Transferred from tnmd on 1/14/2011.]

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 1:11-dp-20029; Shepherd v. DePuy Orthopaedics, Inc.;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Northern District of Ohio
extension.docketText: ORDER: This case is REFERRED to the Magistrate Judge for customized case management in accordance with Local Rule 16.01. Discovery is not stayedabsent order of the District Judge. This case shall be set for trial upon completion of the initial case management conference by order of the District Judge in accordance with the procedures of Local Rule 16.01(d)(5). titleInfo.title: Shepherd v. DePuy Orthopaedics, Inc.
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 6 Motion to Stay Proceedings Pending Transfer to MDL NO. 2197. All proceedings and all deadlines, in the above-captioned case are STAYED pending transfer of this matter to MDL 2197 in the Northern District of Ohio. Defendants shall have 21 days from the date on which this case is transferred to MDL No. 2197 to respond to the Complaint. Signed by Chief Judge Todd J. Campbell on 12/21/10. (dt) [Transferred from tnmd on 1/14/2011.]

titleInfo.title: Shepherd v. DePuy Orthopaedics, Inc.
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER: Pursuant to the Conditional Transfer Order of the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation, Docket No. 2197, this case is hereby transferred to the United States District Court for the Northern District of Ohio for coordinated or consolidated pretrial proceedings. The Clerk of Court is directed to close the case and electronically transmit the record to the United States District Court for the Northern District of Ohio. Signed by Chief Judge Todd J. Campbell on 1/13/11. (dt)[Transferred from tnmd on 1/14/2011.]
